intro: Oritrophium tergoalbum, commonly known as the whiteleaf goldenhead, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant has basal and stem leaves that are typically lobed or divided, with a rough, hairy texture. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Oritrophium tergoalbum is often found in regions with well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
